item.description: About Me I’m an environmental economist that enjoys applying ideas from economics, physics, ecology, and mathematics in my research. Most of my work focuses on the structural modeling of bioeconomic systems. I currently contribute to a project on the integrated management of endangered species and hydropower generation on the Colorado River. New work has me expanding to other rivers. I am teaching undergraduate ‘Metrics this Fall. In that class, I show students how some correlations do have a causal interpretation—after some very clever storytelling.
